name: interpose
content:
interpose verb [T]
(PUT BETWEEN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put yourself or something between two things, people, or groups, especially in order to stop them doing something: The teacher interposed herself between the two snarling boys.

interpose verb [T]
(INTERRUPT)
to interrupt someone: [ + speech ] "I can't agree with you, Mr Heath," he interposed.
